page.title: 09HOUSING
page.content: Stamford is a very old town, and its housing patterns reflect its periods of change and growth. The centre of the town has old stone houses dating back many centuries reflectng Stamford's prosperity as a woolen market centre during the middle ages. There was much development in Victorian times as some industry moved to Stamford. This is mainly in the NE of the town, although there is also some prosperous development in the west of the town. We think the bosses must have lived there! There is some Edwardian development in patches but the major period of growth has been since the 1960s in large housing estates on the west of the town. There is also some 1940s- council housing, due to the development of Peterborough as a local centre for jobs.
